questions.question: A ball is thrown vertically upward with initial velocity $20 \text{ m s}^{-1}$. Taking $g = 10 \text{ m s}^{-2}$, the maximum height reached is:
questions.explanation: At max height, $v = 0$. Using $v^2 = u^2 - 2gs$: $0 = 400 - 20s$, $s = 20$ m

questions.question: A 5 kg object accelerates at $3 \text{ m s}^{-2}$ on a frictionless surface. The net force is:
A car starts from rest and reaches $30 \text{ m s}^{-1}$ in $10$ s with uniform acceleration. Find the distance traveled (in metres).
Two objects ($3$ kg and $2$ kg) collide and stick together. The 3 kg object was moving at $4 \text{ m s}^{-1}$ and the 2 kg was stationary. The velocity after collision is:
A 2 kg block slides down a frictionless incline of height 5 m. Its speed at the bottom is ($g = 10 \text{ m s}^{-2}$):
questions.explanation: By conservation of energy: $mgh = \frac{1}{2}mv^2$. $v = \sqrt{2gh} = \sqrt{2 \times 10 \times 5} = \sqrt{100} = 10 \text{ m s}^{-1}$

questions.question: A projectile is launched at $30째$ above the horizontal with speed $40 \text{ m s}^{-1}$. The time to reach maximum height is ($g = 10 \text{ m s}^{-2}$):
questions.explanation: $v_y = u\sin 30째 = 40 \times 0.5 = 20 \text{ m s}^{-1}$. At max height $v_y = 0$: $t = \frac{v_y}{g} = \frac{20}{10} = 2$ s

questions.question: A force of $50$ N acts on a $10$ kg box at an angle of $60째$ above the horizontal on a frictionless surface. Find the horizontal acceleration in $\text{m s}^{-2}$.
Newton's third law states:
options: Every action has an equal and opposite reaction on a different body
An object at rest stays at rest unless acted on by a force
Every action has an equal and opposite reaction on the same body
questions.explanation: Newton's third law: action-reaction pairs act on different bodies, are equal in magnitude, and opposite in direction. They are the same type of force.

questions.question: The work done by gravity on a $2$ kg object falling $10$ m is ($g = 10 \text{ m s}^{-2}$):
questions.explanation: $W = mgh = 2 \times 10 \times 10 = 200$ J (positive because force and displacement are in the same direction)

questions.question: A 1000 kg car brakes from $20 \text{ m s}^{-1}$ to rest. The kinetic energy dissipated is:
A constant force of $10$ N accelerates a body from rest to $v$ in time $t$. The power at time $t$ is:
questions.explanation: $P = Fv = 10v$. Also, $v = \frac{Ft}{m} = \frac{10t}{m}$, so $P = 10 \cdot \frac{10t}{m} = \frac{100t}{m}$. Both expressions are equivalent.
